name: 4-n-hexyloxyphenol
Reason: 4-n-hexyloxyphenol has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is 4-hexylphenol, which has a melting point of 50 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the hexyloxy group (–O–) adds approximately +2 degrees Celsius due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The methoxy group (–O–) can raise the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius due to additional molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding. The hexyl group (CCCCCCOc1ccc(cc1)O) adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces.
